articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Russian forces stationed in the southern border region of Rostov fired the missile that killed Reuters safety adviser Ryan Evans and wounded two of the agency's journalists when it struck a hotel in eastern Ukraine last month, four Ukrainian security sources said.
articles.title: Russian forces fired missile that killed Reuters safety adviser, Ukraine says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States, France and several allies called for an immediate 21-day ceasefire following intense discussions at the United Nations.
articles.title: Lebanese prime minister believes ceasefire between Israel and Hezbollah possible

articles.author: Matt Spetalnick, John Irish, Humeyra Pamuk
articles.description: U.S. efforts to secure a Gaza ceasefire remain stalled after nearly a year of fighting. Iran-backed Houthi rebels continue to attack Red Sea shipping. And now, despite intense U.S.-led diplomacy, the Israel-Hezbollah conflict threatens to flare into an all-out regional war.
articles.title: US diplomacy in Mideast falters as clock ticks down for Biden

articles.author: Steve Holland, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The aid includes the first shipment of a precision-guided glide bomb called the Joint Standoff Weapon, with a range of up to 81 miles, giving Ukraine a major upgrade.
articles.title: Biden announces $8 billion in military aid for Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's newest nuclear-powered attack submarine sank earlier this year, a senior U.S. defense official said on Thursday, a potential embarrassment for Beijing as it seeks to expand its military capabilities.
articles.title: Chinese nuclear-powered submarine sank earlier this year, US official says

articles.author: Sakura Murakami, John Geddie
articles.description: Japan's ruling party will hold one of the most unpredictable leadership contests in decades on Friday, a race that could result in Japan's youngest or first female premier, or see a popular veteran succeed in his fifth and final leadership bid.
articles.title: Japan's LDP picks new leader to replace outgoing PM Kishida

articles.author: Rich McKay, Brendan O'Brien, Andrew Hay
articles.description: Helene roared ashore Florida's Big Bend region as one of the most powerful storms to hit the United States, with officials fearing the hurricane would leave a trail of deaths and widespread destruction as it moved inland.
articles.title: Hurricane Helene hits Florida as one of the largest storms to strike US

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Saurabh Sharma, Subrata Nag Choudhury, Arpan Chaturvedi
articles.description: Most sex crimes are tried by India's heavily burdened state courts, but only six tribunals are operational in West Bengal, where there are some 48,600 cases of rape and other sexual offences pending judgement.
articles.title: Exclusive: India cuts target for fast-track sex crime courts as states fall short

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Australia and Britain said they would strike a bilateral treaty to produce a new class of nuclear-powered submarine, under the AUKUS partnership which also includes the United States.
articles.title: Australia, Britain to strike treaty for joint production of submarines

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Israel rejected global calls on Thursday for a ceasefire with Hezbollah, defying Washington.
articles.title: Blinken tells Israel escalation will make civilian return more difficult
